books.title: Hester
books.author: Margaret Oliphant
books.summary: The daughter of a failed banker is drawn into conflict with her father’s cousin who saved the bank.

books.title: Tarzan of the Apes
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An orphan is raised by apes in Africa and goes on various adventures.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Blue Bird
books.author: Maurice Maeterlinck
books.summary: Two children go on a magical adventure in search of the Blue Bird.

books.title: Love Among the Chickens
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Stanley Ukridge ensnares the narrator in another one of his schemes: running a chicken farm in the English countryside.

books.title: Romeo and Juliet
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: The children of two opposing houses fall in love.

books.title: The Lost Continent
books.author: C. J. Cutcliffe Hyne
books.summary: A swashbuckling adventure on the fabled continent of Atlantis.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Guy de Maupassant
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Guy de Maupassant, in order of date of composition.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.

books.title: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A legendary Belgian detective comes out of retirement to investigate a friend’s murder.

books.title: The Practice and Theory of Bolshevism
books.author: Bertrand Russell
books.summary: Bertrand Russell travels to post-revolutionary Russia to see if Bolshevism achieves its communist aspirations.

books.title: Principia Ethica
books.author: G. E. Moore
books.summary: An analysis of the concept of good that diagnoses the history of ethics as being marred by the “naturalistic fallacy” while discussing intrinsic goods and evils.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Voltairine de Cleyre
books.summary: A collection of Voltairine de Cleyre’s poetry.

books.title: Sartor Resartus
books.author: Thomas Carlyle
books.summary: The meta-fictional commentary on the life of “famous” German philosopher Diogenes Teufelsdröckh and his Philosophy of Clothes.

books.title: Triplanetary
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: In a universe where all powerful alien races influence the fates of worlds, a war erupts between the Triplanetary League of the inner solar system, pirates led by a mysterious and malicious scientist, and technologically advanced aliens.

books.title: Lais
books.author: Marie de France
books.summary: A collection of twelfth-century medieval tales of chivalry and romance.

books.title: A Confession
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A brief meditation on depression, philosophy, religion, and the meaning of life.

books.title: The Giant Raft
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: An ex-slave trader with an encrypted note schemes about its meaning, while a man with a secret past travels with his family down the Amazon in a giant raft to attend his daughter’s wedding.
